Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, the film depicts his adolescence in the country, the ideals he holds about the agricultural, and his ideals in regards to human nature, which was featured in his poems and publications up to his days. This movie is nothing short of a dark, gritty masterpiece. I may be bias, as the Apartheid era is an area I've always felt for South Africans. The movie is as dark and depressing as the Apartheid period, really, but the light of the hope made by Desmond Tutu and his efforts for reconciliation in the reunion of the divided nation literally shone throughout
